data.title: BELGIAN QUEEN KILLED
data.meta_description: The Queen of the Belgians was killed this morning when a motor car in which she was driving crashed into a tree. The King of the Belgians, who was driving the ...
data.text:
KING LEOPOLD, owing to some

cause which has not yet

been explained, lost control of the

car while he was driving on the

road beside the lake at Kuss-

nacht. The vehicle swerved into

a belt of trees alongside the lake,

and the Queen, who was sharing

the front seat with the King, was

killed instantly.

The chauffeur, who was in the

rear seat, escaped injury.

According to another version of the

tragedy the Queen (formerly Princess

Astrid of Sweden) was alone in the

back seat of the car at the time of

the occurrence, and she experienced

the full force of the impact with the

tree.

Later details suggest that the car

had not recovered its direction after it

had negotiated a sharp curve on a nar-

row road at the water's edge.

King Leopold and Queen Astrid had

been spending a holiday of some

weeks' duration in the Swiss and Ital-

ian Alps. They had just visited Dolo-

mite Peak (in the Tyrol), where there

is a tablet commemorating the late

King's Albert's feat in having ascended

the peak.

Their Majesties had been staying at

a villa near Lucerne. After King Leo-

pold's wounds had been bandaged he

was taken back to the villa, to which

place the body of Queen Astrid was

also removed.

STORY OF EYE-WITNESS

An eye-witness states that the car

was travelling at 30 miles an hour,

when it suddenly skidded, hit a small

embankment a foot high, and re-

bounded against a tree.

The Queen was thrown through the

window of the car. She was terribly

cut, and her skull was fractured.

The car, with the King still clinging

to the wheel, ran into a small field,
